content:
StickyNoteControl Class

In this Article

Represents a control that lets users attach typed text or handwritten annotations to documents.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_CloseButton", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.Button))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_TitleThumb", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_ResizeBottomRightThumb", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_ContentControl", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_IconButton", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.Button))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_CopyMenuItem", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_PasteMenuItem", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_InkMenuItem", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_SelectMenuItem", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_EraseMenuItem", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem))]
public sealed class StickyNoteControl : System.Windows.Controls.Control

Remarks

A sticky note provides a rectangular area whose content is separate from the text, image, or other material to which the note is anchored.

The StickyNoteControl class and its members are public so that it can be styled, but is no public constructor. Instances are created with the CreateTextStickyNoteCommand and CreateInkStickyNoteCommand of the AnnotationService class.

When a sticky note is created, it is designated as one of two types:

  • Text sticky notes have a RichTextBox content area that can be written and edited like any other Rich Text area. Users can type into it and can also cut, copy, and paste both within the note and between the note and other applications. Images can also be pasted into the note. The usual Rich Text keyboard shortcuts are also available.

  • Ink sticky notes have an InkCanvas content area and it can be edited like other ink canvasses. For example, strokes can be erased. With a tablet PC or other suitable hardware, users can enter handwritten notes.

    The user interface (UI) of the StickyNoteControl makes it a more powerful way to annotate material than marking up a hardcopy or using physical handwritten notes. It is also more flexible than simply adding to, or striking through, the text of a document.

  • Sticky notes can be resized.

  • Sticky notes can be minimized to an icon and expanded.

  • When maximized, a sticky note can be dragged to a new position in a window without changing the location of its anchor.

  • The exact content to which a sticky note applies is highlighted and marked off with brackets.

  • Two or more sticky notes can apply to the same content or to overlapping content.

  • When change occurs within the document content to which a sticky note is anchored, the sticky note's position moves in position relative to the content to which it was bound.

  • With text sticky notes, lines will wrap automatically. If the note is resized, lines will re-wrap as needed. If content extends below the bottom of the note, a vertical scroll bar will appear.

  • With ink sticky notes, vertical and horizontal scroll bars will appear whenever content extends beyond the boundaries of the note.

Fields summary

AuthorProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.Author* dependency property.
CaptionFontFamilyProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontFamily* dependency property.
CaptionFontSizeProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontSize* dependency property.
CaptionFontStretchProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontStretch* dependency property.
CaptionFontStyleProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontStyle* dependency property.
CaptionFontWeightProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontWeight* dependency property.
DeleteNoteCommand

Represents a command whose stem.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.Execute* method deletes a StickyNoteControl.
InkCommand

Represents a command whose stem.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.Execute* method will switch the cursor in an ink sticky note to one of several possible modes, including draw and erase.
InkSchemaName

Gets the Xml type of the ink sticky note annotation.
IsActiveProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsActive* dependency property.
IsExpandedProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsExpanded* dependency property.
IsMouseOverAnchorProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsMouseOverAnchor* dependency property.
PenWidthProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.PenWidth* dependency property.
StickyNoteTypeProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.StickyNoteType* dependency property.
TextSchemaName

Gets the Xml type of the text sticky note annotation.

Properties summary

AnchorInfo

Gets an object that provides information about the annotated object.
Author

Gets the name of the author who created the sticky note.
CaptionFontFamily

Gets or sets the font family of the caption for the StickyNoteControl.
CaptionFontSize

Gets or sets the size of the font used for the caption of the StickyNoteControl.
CaptionFontStretch

Gets or sets the degree to which the font used for the caption of the StickyNoteControl is stretched.
CaptionFontStyle

Gets or sets the style of the font used for the caption of the StickyNoteControl.
CaptionFontWeight

Gets or sets the weight of the font used for the caption of the StickyNoteControl.
IsActive

Gets a value indicating whether the StickyNoteControl is active.
IsExpanded

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the StickyNoteControl is expanded.
IsMouseOverAnchor

Gets a value indicating whether the mouse cursor is over the anchor of the StickyNoteControl.
PenWidth

Gets or sets the width of the pen for an ink StickyNoteControl.
StickyNoteType

Gets a value that indicates whether the sticky note is text or ink.

  • InkCommand

    Represents a command whose stem.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.Execute* method will switch the cursor in an ink sticky note to one of several possible modes, including draw and erase.

    public static readonly System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand InkCommand;

    Remarks

    When used, the InkCommand takes a parameter of type InkCanvasEditingMode. The command's Execute method will put the cursor in the mode specified by the parameter.

    Gets an object that provides information about the annotated object.

    public System.Windows.Annotations.IAnchorInfo AnchorInfo { get; }

    Property Value

    Remarks

    This property enables you to match the sticky note with the corresponding annotated object.

    AnchorInfo is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

    • StickyNoteType

      A StickyNoteType value indicating the type of note. The default is StickyNoteType.

    Remarks

    An ink StickyNoteControl can be used for handwritten notes on a tablet PC or other hardware that supports handwritten input.
